I have a singleton called "ConfigManager", where in its constructor 
it reads in a bunch of files from a directory and creates objectsfrom 
the files.  I am doing this because I want to say "ConfigManager is 
not valid until these other objects have also been successfully 
created".  

I want the "ConfigManager" to be able to read a directory full 
of "bad files" in some test scenarios, a directory full of "good 
files" in other test scenarios, and a directory full of "good and bad 
files" in yet other test scenarios.  Ultimately, the program will 
have to handle "good and bad files",

My problem is that I need to "trick" the "ConfigManager" into using 
the three directories in different test scenarios, but I dont want to 
alter the fact that all objects are created in "ConfigManager's" 
constructor.  Here is what is in the constructor for the 
singleton "ConfigManager":
----------------------------------------------------
String basePath = ServiceResources.CONFIG_FILE_DIRECTORY;
setBaseDirectory(basePath);
loadAllFilesFound(getBaseDirectory());
loadConfigFilesFound(getAllFilesFoundList());
ArrayList configList = createConfigurations(getConfigFilesFound());
TriggerManager tm = TriggerManager.getInstance();
ArrayList triggerList = tm.createTriggers(configList);
tm.registerTriggers(triggerList);
----------------------------------------------------

How can I switch the CONFIG_FILE_DIRECTORY value for testing when its 
in the constructor?
